body.name: ComfyBumpy Extra Long Toddler Bed Rails - Baby Bed Rail Guard for Kids, Twin, Full, King and Queen Beds - Adjustable Bed Rail for Toddlers - Baby Bed Side Bedrails - White, XL (59" x 19.5"), Pack of 2
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Sunday, February 18. Order within 18 hrs 41 mins
features: 2 PACK BED RAILS - Adjustable bed rail for toddlers allows your child to be secured safely but without feeling the bars under their mattress. Install each bed rail on both sides of your bed for additional security. Your toddler will sleep safely and comfortably all night long!
FOLD DOWN DESIGN - ComfyBumpy baby bed rail guard features a curved pull down design that fits easily around the bed frame. With swing down toddler bed rails, it's easy to get in and out of bed!
NO GAPS OR HOLES - Baby bed side bedrails ensure there are no gaps, holes or weak spots that can compromise the safety of your child. Works with slatted beds, box springs or wooden base beds!
UNIVERSAL FIT - Our bed rails are designed for king size bed, queen bed, twin, full size bed and more. Toddler side rails are suitable for standard mattresses up to 12 inches thick.
EASY TO INSTALL - The unique triple-way attachment system comes with velcro to attach to a slat bed base, adjustable straps to secure to box springs, and screws to attach to wooden bases.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works nice . Simple to put together. Long enough to cover length if a twin. Strong enough if kid is up against it they don't fall out. Love I can drop rail down when not using

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
reviews.reviewText: We bought four of the large extended versions for our two toddlers transitioning from their cribs to twin beds. We bought them planning for the transition in a few weeks. But when the kids started climbing out of their cribs, we had to move fast to put the bed and bed rails together before bedtime one night.I had spent hours researching toddler bed rails online because we have platform twin beds with wood slats holding up the mattress, but no box spring. SO MANY of these bed rails DO NOT WORK WITH PLATFORM BEDS and especially with slats. THESE RAILS DO WORK WITH PLATFORM BEDS with slats or plywood bases and they come with the necessary parts for each type.From my research, I found out that many bed rails are not able to sit on the platform (whether they are solid plywood or slats) and still reach above the edge of the bed frame so they can fold down. And, many bed rails are not able to fasten correctly to a platform, either. THIS MODEL WORKS PERFECTLY with our platform bed with slats and folds up and down perfectly. It is strong enough to hold our 2 1/2 year olds when they are pushing on the rails.PLEASE WATCH THE ONLINE INSTRUCTIONS!!! The instruction book that comes with is very confusing and the pictures are all very close up so you can't tell what parts they are trying to show you. Also if you ordered this EXTENDED version, NEITHER THE BOOK NOR THE ONLINE VIDEO SHOWS WHAT TO DO WITH THE EXTENSION PART. I saw so many reviews here that said the mesh was too big for the rails and there was an extra piece left over. Well, duh, that's the extension piece meant to fit the extra long mesh. Please read the comments and understand the extra piece is meant to go in between the shorter ends so it extends all the way out and the mesh fits over the whole frame.Otherwise, these were very easy to put together after watching the video. We initially installed them with the velcro on the slats, but for other reasons, we added a piece of plywood over the slats (because there was a large gap at the head and end of the bed all the way to the ground where the kids could get stuck). We then screwed the bed rail supports into the plywood, making sure the screws didn't protrude through the plywood - because you know kids will crawl under their beds...Finally, because these are so long, it's hard to release the locks and fold them down with both hands at the same time. I can't reach all the way from one end to the other at all. So, my trick is to: 1) Unlock one end; 2) Pull it toward you so it doesn't re-lock; 3) Keep holding the rail and then slide your hand down toward the other end, pulling the rail toward you a bit so the first end doesn't re-lock; 4) When you get to the other end, keep pulling it toward you a bit and unlock the second end. The whole bed rail should then release and fold down easily. I have done this many times and even one-handed with a baby in one arm. On our small twin beds, the rails fold all the way down so they're parallel with the side of the bed. They don't stick out at all when folded down.Good luck!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great product, horrible instructions.
reviews.reviewText: Whoever wrote the instructions manual needs to be euthanized. I had to toss away the instructions manual, it was making the assembly process more confusing. Other than that great product.

reviews.reviewText: This works so well for my toddler's single bed. Fits perfect, easy to install. You can easily snap it down for easy access, but not easy for a child to snap down. Breathable and great material. Good value. Fast ship, and great packaging. No smell. Recommend. Thank you!

reviews.reviewText: i LOVE this bed rail. my kiddo and I have coslept for quite some time now, just the two of us. this product gave me the peace of mind that i needed once he started to toss and turn in bed. it's easy to install, but a little difficult to put together. i would absolutely use this again for my next kiddo when the time comes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not ideal for a toddler bed.
reviews.reviewText: The product came quickly and was easy to assemble. It looks very nice and the structure feels very sturdy once all the pieces are in place. It has a smaller profile than some of the similar guard rails on the market, which is why we ordered it. However, I will say that I was a little disappointed with a couple of things. First, the description of the item leads you to believe that this will work on just about any type of bed and situation. It lists convertible crib in the title, but I can assure you that the anchor straps provided DO NOT work with a toddler sized mattress. The straps are adjustable (and oddly come in a hideous cream color, which is weird since everything else is bright white, but doesn't really matter because it's hidden under the mattress anyway), but even at their shortest length are probably only for a twin bed. I believe what the manufacturer wants is for you to not use these straps with toddler bed, but rather velcro the metal legs of the structure to the springs of crib/toddler bed. This does not work for us since we have a dust ruffle over top the springs, but more importantly didn't feel that solution alone would adequately secure the guard rail. What's frustrating here is that all the manufacturer needs to do is allow the cream straps to adjust to the width of a toddler bed...problem solved. The second problem is that the guard rail is under UNBELIEVABLE tension when in the locked position. DO NOT plan on one person being able to easily lower the rail. Maybe that changes over time as the fabric relaxes a little. But I am a strong guy with a 6'5" wingspan and I couldn't drop the rail down without using my chest to lower it while my hands lifted the locks. The first time I used it, the rail slipped off my chest when it was halfway down (45 degrees) and had so much tension that it whipped up a hit me in the chin, causing me to bite my tongue and leaving a bruise on my jaw bone. I guess the takeaway there is always plan on it being a two person job.Once it is lowered, the tension releases completely. I understand some tension is necessary to keep the entire structure rigid, but it shouldn't be so much that it is essentially a loaded catapult when upright. Again, this leads me to believe this was not really designed with a toddler bed in mind, as the toddler bed scenario is when the lowering function is most likely to be frequently used.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really like this. Believe it or not, I got it so I didnt worry about my Pomeranian rolling off the bed at night because he sleeps on the bed with me. He actually is more relaxed now that its up.I had one once before when my grand daughter was a baby. Its very sturdy and stays in place.A good buy.
Item barely offers protection as it is just a fee inches higher than our mattress.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a good fit for king size mattress
reviews.reviewText: Had to return... description says that it is an extra tall model to fit on a king size bed however since the mattress is thicker than smaller beds, the bedrail is barely taller than the mattress. Child would easily pass over bedrail as it was barely 5 cm over mattress...Product would be good on smaller beds..

reviews.reviewTitle: does NOT fit king sized bed. UNABLE TO RETURN!
reviews.reviewText: This does NOT fit a king sized bed. I tried to return it and it costs MORE then the product itself to return. Now I am stuck with it. DO NOT BUY this if you're wanting it for a king sized bed. This would work for at best a toddler bed.
